text:
Hey everyone! I'm Atreya, new to the community :slightly_smiling_face:

I found Julia extremely interesting when I stumbled upon it and I feel like Julia can overtake python when it comes to scientific computation in the years to come. I want to help accelerate this process by contributing as much as possible!

How do I get started?

elements.text: Hey everyone! I'm Atreya, new to the community

I found Julia extremely interesting when I stumbled upon it and I feel like Julia can overtake python when it comes to scientific computation in the years to come. I want to help accelerate this process by contributing as much as possible!

How do I get started?

text: Hello and welcome! I think the best way is to get good at Julia, and then make interesting new packages or enhance existing ones. The biggest advantage Python has over Julia is its bigger ecosystem. Improving Julia's ecosystem is both easier than improving Julia itself, and also has a bigger impact, I think

elements.text: Hello and welcome! I think the best way is to get good at Julia, and then make interesting new packages or enhance existing ones. The biggest advantage Python has over Julia is its bigger ecosystem. Improving Julia's ecosystem is both easier than improving Julia itself, and also has a bigger impact, I think

text: It especially has a bigger impact in the sciences it only takes one or a few really good "killer packages" is a field for the language to become ubiquitous.

elements.text: It especially has a bigger impact in the sciences it only takes one or a few really good "killer packages" is a field for the language to become ubiquitous.

text:
First, make sure you get to know and love the online <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/|documentation>.  Don’t forget the <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> page too, which is good for a lot of getting started questions.
Different people learn and gain skills in different ways - you might just pick a task you’re interested in and start coding.  Or maybe take program in another language and try to translate it.  For me personally, it would be hard to start to work on unsolved problems in an existing package.

attachments.title: JuliaLang
attachments.text: The Julia programming language forum: discuss usage, development, packages, and community.
